subtitle: Chopped chicken and bacon is cooked with watercress and pistachio nuts in this tasty pate. Makes a great prepare-ahead starter.

method.text: Lay the rashers of streaky bacon out on a board. Run the back of a knife over the bacon to stretch slightly.
Use all but one to line the bottom and sides of a lightly greased and base-lined 450 g loaf tin. Leave enough bacon hanging over the edge to fold over and enclose the filling, once filled.
Melt the butter in a pan. Add the onion and garlic. Fry for 2-3 min until softened. Leave to cool slightly.
In a bowl, mix together the chicken, bacon, watercress, pistachio nuts, egg and seasoning. Stir in the onion and garlic mixture.
Spoon the chicken mixture into the lined loaf tin. Carefully smooth over the surface. Fold down the overhanging bacon. Top with the remaining rasher of bacon.
Cover with foil. Cook in the oven for 30 min.
Remove foil and leave to cook for a further 15 min.
Remove from oven. Leave to cool completely on a wire rack before removing from tin.
Carefully turn the loaf out onto a serving plate.

title: Chicken, watercress and pistachio nut pate
